thread.title: "We need a medic!" Amy Willerton involved in scary crash during Skeleton training on The Jump
thread.title_full: "We need a medic!" Amy Willerton involved in scary crash during Skeleton training on The Jump

author: Zoe Shenton
title: "We need a medic!" Amy Willerton involved in scary crash during Skeleton training on The Jump
text:
"We need a medic!" Amy Willerton involved in scary crash during Skeleton training on The Jump The former Miss Universe slams into a wall in scenes that will air this weekend Share Amy Willerton smashed into a wall (Photo: Channel 4 / PA) Share Get celebs   
Amy Willerton is the latest celebrity to be caught up in a scary accident on Channel 4 show The Jump. 
The former Miss Universe, 24, was training for the Skeleton event when she ran into trouble. 
In scenes that will air on Sunday, the I'm A Celebrity beauty is lying on a small sled face forward. 
“Wait, wait Marcus, wait. Can I just gather my thoughts for a sec?” she asks nervously as she waits to set off from the top of the tall icy slide. 
“Ok, so I’m going to enjoy this, right?” she continues after psyching herself up. Amy Willerton on the skeleton bobsled (Photo: Channel 4) Amy Willerton on the skeleton bobsled (Photo: Channel 4) 
Cameras then catch her speeding down the slide on her front before she smashes into a wall. 
Former Olympic athlete Graham Bell, providing the commentary, says: "Amy is on. Big slide. Big slide! She's off! Crashed." 
As she continues to glide down the slide, seemingly motionless, someone yells, "We need a medic!" 
Amy's crash comes after Sir Bradley Wiggins was forced to pull out of the show after fracturing his leg. Read More
